node.title: 3x3 basketball rebounds from international disappointment
node.description: New Zealand were the first 3x3 basketball world champions but missing a pinnacle event last year was a blow the successful programme needs to bounce back from. Video

node.title: Things to look out for after Football World Cup draw
node.description: The draw for the Fifa World Cup Qatar 2022 is done and it has thrown out some intriguing fixtures.

node.title: 'People are pretty good in heart' - Meng Foon on race in Aotearoa
node.description: Race Relations Commissioner Meng Foon reflects on two and a half years in the role, and the job he'd like next.

node.title: Sarah Palin announces run for US Congress
node.description: Sarah Palin, the republican vice presidential nominee in 2008, has announced she will campaign for Alaska's only seat in the US House of Representatives.

node.title: Eighth candidate announces bid for Auckland mayoralty
node.description: There has a been a late entry to the Auckland mayoral race.

node.title: Crusaders survive Highlanders onslaught in Super Rugby Pacific
node.description: The Crusaders have survived a late red card and a scoreless second half to keep the Highlanders winless in Super Rugby Pacific.

node.title: Will Smith resigns from Academy after Oscars slap
node.description: Actor Will Smith has resigned from Hollywood's prestigious Academy, after slapping presenter Chris Rock at the Oscars, Variety reported. Video

node.title: Invercargill water restrictions may ramp up if rain doesn't arrive
node.description: The council has already banned unattended hosing and sprinklers under the first stage of restrictions to protect the city's sole water supply, the Ōreti River.

node.title: Damaged Tokomaru Bay bridge reopens
node.description: The flood-damaged bridge at Tokomaru Bay in Gisborne has been repaired and was reopened today, reconnecting the area with the wider community.

node.title: Five-month delay to set up eligibility criteria for new funding for crime victims
node.description: It took the government more than five months to approve the final eligibility criteria for money set aside for crime victims out of Budget 2021.

node.title: Covid-19 update: 23 new deaths, 11,560 community cases, 678 in hospital
node.description: There are 11,560 new community cases of Covid-19 and 23 additional deaths to report today.

node.title: Work begins to move rocks from Waiheke penguin site
node.description: Protesters have gathered around a marina construction site on Waiheke, where developers are removing rocks from part of a wall that is home to little blue penguins.

node.title: Work begins to move rare penguins from Waiheke site
node.description: Protesters have gathered around a marina construction site on Waiheke, where developers are removing a rock wall that is home to little blue penguins.

node.title: Tanks and bodies mark path as Russia moves troops from Kyiv
node.description: Ukraine recaptured more territory around Kyiv from Russian soldiers as they moved away from the capital, while a disputed cross-border strike in Russia complicated peace talks.

node.title: Two types of Suave aerosol deodorant recalled due to elevated benzene levels
node.description: The FDA said benzene exposure from the levels detected in the product "would not be expected to cause adverse health consequences," citing an independent health hazard evaluation.

node.title: New York workers vote to form first US union at Amazon
node.description: Amazon.com workers have voted to form the first union at the second-largest US private employer, a victory adding to other recent labour activist successes.

node.title: Police appeal for sightings of missing Taupō man's bike
node.description: Police searching for Taupō man Michael Yewen, who was last seen two months ago, are asking for sightings of his bike.

node.title: Māori dying with Covid-19 because of misinformation - health leader
node.description: A Māori health leader says a new international misinformation study confirms the alarm many were desperately trying to raise last year about the impact on Māori during the initial vaccine rollout.

node.title: Auckland to host New Zealand's first T rex
node.description: A visitor from 66 million years ago - the first Tyrannosaurus rex to be displayed in Aotearoa - will be on show at Tāmaki Paenga Hira this month.

node.title: Bitumen producer eyes opportunity as Z Energy plans exit
node.description: A Taranaki company is about to make its own bitumen, stepping into the void left by the Marsden Pt oil refinery shutdown.

node.title: NZ's biggest waste company sells to Australian investment fund for $1.9b
node.description: Waste Management, the country's biggest waste company, has been sold to an Australian investment fund for $1.9 billion, according to an Australian media report.

node.title: Controversial government tourism fund saved jobs, propped up business, recipient says
node.description: The $290m Strategic Tourism Assets Protection Programme was formed to provide rapid support for NZ's significant tourism assets, but it's come under scrutiny with concerns about transparency.

node.title: Surviving hostage testifies about ordeal in ISIS captivity
node.description: El Shafee Elsheikh, member of the ISIS group nicknamed "the Beatles," is on trial in Virginia facing hostage and terrorism charges.

node.title: Former Alaska Governor Sarah Palin announces run for Congress
node.description: Alaska will hold special election this summer to replace the House seat left vacant when Rep. Don Young died earlier this month.

node.title: Transport minister on board with Auckland’s half-price public transport
node.description: Minister of Transport Michael Wood is remaining tight-lipped on whether the government has plans to extend cut-price fares for public transport users beyond 30 June.

node.title: Bruce Willis 'worst performance' award cancelled
node.description: Razzie organisers said it was "not appropriate" after the announcement about the actor's health issues.

node.title: NIWA scientists to map Tonga eruption's impact on seabed
node.description: NIWA scientists are undertaking a mission to discover the undersea impacts of the recent Tongan volcanic eruption.

node.title: Yemen's warring parties agree two-month truce in major breakthrough
node.description: The warring sides in Yemen's seven-year conflict have for the first time in years agreed a nationwide truce, says the United Nations envoy.

node.title: Will Smith resigns from the Academy after slapping Chris Rock at Oscars
node.description: "My actions at the 94th Academy Awards presentation were shocking, painful, and inexcusable," Smith said in a statement.

node.title: 12-year-old fatally shot in New York City as violent crime spikes nationwide
node.description: Nationally, homicide rates have risen by an average of 37% in the biggest cities.
